p.s: The given text is aan excerpt from the novel The Hate U Give, written by Angie Thomas, published 2019 by Cornelsen, and is about the discrimination against African-Americans in American society and the desire to change that.
The events take place after hearing the court's decision about the police officer's sentence, who shot Khalil Harris.
Full of anger about not being able to get justice for Khalil, Starr, Seven, DeVante and Chris drive to the place, where Khalil was killed and protests are being held in order to join in.
There Starr sees her attorney, Ms. Ofrah, who is standing on a police car and is leading the protest.
Starr joins in with the chants until Ms. Ofrah notices and walks up to her.
Starr begs her to let her participate and Ms. Ofrah leads her to the police car she stood on.
Suddenly Starr is expected to speak up.

She is uneasy and nervous, but after the crowd shows their support, she feels reassured and says what she has wanted to tell everyone and especially the police about the truth of the unjustice she witnessed.
